intro: Stillingia spinulosa, commonly known as the spiked stillingia, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Stillingia spinulosa is typically found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade.
